intro: Catostemma fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant catostemma, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It produces small, round berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Catostemma fragrans thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and wetlands.
